pageContext.claim: “In Wisconsin, I was very instrumental in getting FoxConn to come. A good friend of mine and a great guy. They make a lot of that Apple iPhones. They are incredible, and incredible company. they are building a fantastic plant.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump touted Foxconn's investment announcement, but the company considered investing in U.S.-based facilities since 2014, though its initial plans to invest in Pennsylvania didn't pan out. The deal may not turn out the best for the state: It will take until at least 2043 before Wisconsin earns back the $3 billion payout.
